original: Danell, Gideon, fd. rektor, Ekhaga, Borghamn, f. 31/8/73 i Norrköp. av kyrkoh. Isak D. o. Amanda Petersson. G. 09 m, Anna Gustafson. Barn: Brita f. 16. — Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 91, fil. kand. i Upps. 95, fil. lic. 04, fil. dr 06, provår 06-07. Res. t. Estl. 00, 01, 08, 22, 23 o. 32, Tyskl. 06, Engl. o. Skottl. 12, Finl. 25, Schweiz 29, Tyskl. o. Ös-terr. 30. Medarb. i Sv. akad. ordb. red. i Lund 05-07, doc. i sv. dialektologi v. Lunds univ. 06-07, i nord. språk v. Gbgs högsk.’08-13, e. lär. v. Gbgs latin 08-09, adj. v. Gbgs folksk:sem. 09-13, rektor v. folksk:sem. i Sthlm 13-15, v. sem. i Upps. 15-39, lektor där i modersm. 18-39. Sakk. i ecklrdep. 12-13, 34-35 o. 38-39, led. av stadsfullm. i Upps. 20-22 o. 27-30, av domkap. 37-40, av skolråd o. kyrkoråd i Väversunda sed. 40. Skr.: Nuckömålet (i Sv. Landsmål 05-34), Sv. ljudlära (11), Sv. ’Språklära (27), Kort sv. språklära (28), Till frågan om en skriftspr :reform (35), Sv. språkhist. (40), språkvet:-skapl. o. pedagog, upps. samt upps. om svenskarna i Estl. KN02kl, Hed-LGAA, av Östg. nat. i Upps., av Modersm :lär. fören. o. av Sem:lär. fören.
translated: Danell, Gideon, former principal, Ekhaga, Borghamn, born on August 31st, 1873 in Norrköping to the church warden Isak D. and Amanda Petersson. Married in 1909 to Anna Gustafson with whom he had one child, Brita, born in 1916. He graduated from high school in Norrköping in 1891, received a Bachelor's degree from Uppsala in 1895, a licentiate degree in 1904, a PhD in 1906, and completed a probationary year in 1906-1907. He traveled to Estonia in 1900, 1901, 1908, 1922, 1923, and to Germany in 1906, England and Scotland in 1912, Finland in 1925, and Switzerland in 1929, Germany and Austria in 1930. He worked as a contributor to the Swedish Academy Dictionary and was an editor in Lund from 1905-1907, a lecturer in Swedish dialectology at Lund University in 1906-1907, in Nordic languages at Gothenburg University from 1908-1913, a senior teacher of Latin in Gothenburg from 1908-1909, an adjunct at Gothenburg Teacher's Seminary from 1909-1913, a principal of a teacher's seminary in Stockholm from 1913-1915, a vice principal of a teacher's seminary in Uppsala from 1915-1939, and a Swedish language lecturer at Uppsala University from 1918-1939. He served as an expert in the Ministry of Ecclesiastical Affairs from 1912-1913, 1934-1935, and 1938-1939, was a member of the Uppsala City Council from 1920-1922 and 1927-1930, a member of the cathedral chapter from 1937-1940, and a member of the school board and church council in Väversunda since 1940. He wrote several books, including "Nuckömålet" (in Swedish Landsmål 1905-1934), "Swedish Phonetics" (1911), "Swedish Grammar" (1927), "Short Swedish Grammar" (1928), "Questions about a Written Language Reform" (1935), "Swedish Language History" (1940), linguistic and pedagogical papers, as well as papers on Swedes in Estonia. He was a member of the Royal Society of Humanities and Letters in Gothenburg, the East Gothland National Association in Uppsala, the Association of Swedish Language Teachers and the Association of Teacher's Seminaries.
